comments:
A StackOverflowError has been occurring when trying to use WebSphere 6.0 with the latest WTP/Eclipse milestones. When trying to publish, clean, open the launch config, or perform any action on my WebSphere server, an error occurs: An internal error occurred during: "Publishing to IBM WebSphere 6...". The .log shows a StackOverflowError caused by the Resolver class resolvePropertiesFromCache() method.

Eclipse:   eclipse-SDK-3.3M5eh-win32
Webtools:  I200703011809
Server:    Websphere 6.0.2 Fix pack 17.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 2007-03-06 14:29:46.638
!MESSAGE Unhandled event loop exception
!STACK 0
java.lang.StackOverflowError
	at java.lang.String.<init>(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.substring(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.StringBuffer.substring(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.resolveProperty(Resolver.java:119)
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.resolvePropertiesFromCache(Resolver.java:90)
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.resolvePropertiesFromCache(Resolver.java:91)
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.resolvePropertiesFromCache(Resolver.java:91)
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.resolvePropertiesFromCache(Resolver.java:91)
	at org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.internal.xml.Resolver.resolvePropertiesFromCache(Resolver.java:91)
...
...
...

WebSphere 6.0 publishes and starts correctly in the latest Eclipse 3.2 release with the latest WTP 1.5.3 release, with identical server configuration as used with Eclipse3.3/WTP2.  I have even attempted to start up a fresh workspace, create a new Websphere 6.0 and try to open the launch configuration, same error above.
I could not repro with other servers, can you verify with Websphere

Other servers seem to work fine (ie Tomcat) and yes, this error is still occuring with the current build of webtools, "I200703231630".

Current Setup:
Websphere:   version 6.0.2.17
OS:          WindowsXP Service Pack 2
Java:        Version included with Websphere (1.4.X)

As a temporary work around I have replaced the "Resolver.class" from "org.eclipse.jst.server.generic.core_XXX.jar" with the 1.5.3 release.  I haven't had the time to look through this code, so I can only imagine what other problems replacing this file is having, but it works for now.  If there is any other info you need please let me know.
Could we bump up the severity and priority? This is causing havoc for wtp adopters trying to publish with WAS 6.0.

Created an attachment (id=63542)
Patch to resolve the stack overflow problem

WAS adapter needs the parameter called pathChar
Resolved but not released, waiting for Tim DeBoer to release profiling changes
Naci thanks for providing the patch. I confirmed it worked.
